name: Paneer Paratha
history: Paneer Paratha is a popular dish in Indian cuisine, particularly in North India. It's a flatbread filled with spiced paneer (Indian cottage cheese).
description: Paneer Paratha is a delicious, nutritious Indian flatbread filled with seasoned paneer. It's typically enjoyed as a breakfast dish or a snack, often served with yogurt, pickles, or chutney.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: Used for preparing the dough and the paneer filling.

equipment.name: rolling pin
equipment.description: Used for rolling out the parathas.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, mix the whole wheat flour and water to form a soft dough. Knead well and let it rest.

instructions.title: Make the Paneer Filling
instructions.description: Combine crumbled paneer, onion, green chilies, ginger, coriander leaves, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix thoroughly.

instructions.title: Stuff and Roll the Parathas
instructions.description: Divide the dough into equal portions. Roll each portion, fill with the paneer mixture, seal, and roll again.

instructions.title: Cook the Parathas
instructions.description: Heat a skillet or tawa. Cook each paratha with oil or ghee until both sides are golden brown.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve hot with yogurt, butter, or a tangy pickle.

tips: Ensure the paneer filling is well-spiced for the best flavor.
Be gentle while rolling to prevent the filling from oozing out.
variations: Add grated vegetables to the paneer filling for extra nutrition.
Experiment with different spices or herbs for varied flavors.

storage.shelfLife: Can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat on a skillet before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a skillet or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Serve on a decorative plate with a side of green chutney and fresh salad.
